intro: Conocephalus roxburghii, commonly known as the Himalayan coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
